intro: Grewia pyriformis, commonly known as the pear-shaped wild pear, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in clusters, followed by orange-red, pear-shaped fruits. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture with serrated edges. The fruit is edible and often used in local cuisines, while the plant also has traditional medicinal uses.
